benchmark_details.name: CLIP-SLA (CLIP Sign Language Adaptation)
benchmark_details.overview: CLIP-SLA is a framework that leverages the powerful pre-trained visual encoder from the CLIP model for continuous sign language recognition (CSLR) through parameter-efficient fine-tuning. It introduces two variants, SLA-Adapter and SLA-LoRA, which integrate PEFT modules into the CLIP visual encoder for efficient sign language tasks.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To advance continuous sign language recognition using parameter-efficient fine-tuning methods on pre-trained visual models.

data.source: Four datasets: Phoenix2014, Phoenix2014-T, CSL-Daily, and a new dataset Isharah-500 for continuous Saudi sign language.
data.annotation: Videos contain gloss annotations without explicit temporal boundaries.

methodology.calculation: WER is calculated by measuring the minimum number of edits required to align predicted sequences with the ground truth.
methodology.interpretation: Lower WER indicates better model performance for continuous sign language recognition.
methodology.validation: Performance validated through extensive testing on standard datasets.
